statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content: Pick two numbers ${a}_{i},{a}_{j}(i\neq j)$ from a sequence to maximize the value of their greatest common divisor.

statement.title: Input
statement.content: Multiple test cases. In the first line there is an integer $T$, indicating the number of test cases.  For each test cases, the first line contains an integer $n$, the size of the sequence. Next line contains $n$ numbers, from ${a}_{1}$ to ${a}_{n}$.  $1\leq T\leq 100,2\leq n\leq {10}^{5},1\leq {a}_{i}\leq {10}^{5}$. The case for $n\geq {10}^{4}$ is no more than $10$.

statement.title: Output
statement.content: For each test case, output one line. The output format is Case #$x$: $ans$, $x$ is the case number, starting from $1$, $ans$ is the maximum value of greatest common divisor.
